column4: hello.  I would like to report something awesome that has never happened to me before!  I plugged a new piece of hardware in to a usb slot which I've never used on this OS before-- it's a playstation controller run through a RadioShack USB converter.  This usually requires installing drivers from a floppy, with no other way to acquire them, in order to work in windows.  I just plugged it in and started zsnes, and it was instantly able to take in
I expected to have to set tons of crap up, seeing as this is linux
welcome to the wonderful world of linux ;-)
for more fun, plug a USB mouse into every available USB port and see what happens
